title: Actor
description: Schema for actor JSON files that define actors in the system. Actor files are located in the 'actors/' directory at the model root. The filename (without extension) becomes the actor's key, which is referenced by classes via 'actor_key'. If validation fails, verify 'name' and 'type' are both present and non-empty strings.

name.description: The display name of the actor (e.g., 'Customer', 'Inventory System'). This is the human-readable name shown in diagrams and documentation. Must be non-empty. If validation fails: ensure this is a string with at least one character.

type.description: The type of actor. Common values: 'human' (a person interacting with the system), 'system' (an external software system), 'device' (hardware that interacts with the system). Must be non-empty. If validation fails: ensure this is a non-empty string describing the actor category.

details.description: Optional detailed description of the actor. Describe the actor's role, responsibilities, and how they interact with the system. Useful for documentation and understanding system boundaries.

uml_comment.description: Optional UML comment for diagram annotations. This text appears as a note attached to the actor in generated UML diagrams. Use for diagram-specific clarifications.
